"		Maroon Worksampler is an Android application for conducting work sampling studies." "The app is still in testing mode. For more details, you may contact:

Franz Velasco
fsvelasco@up.edu.ph"

"\t\tIn creating a project, you must add the name of the project, " "choose the confidence level for the study, and choose the source of proportion estimates. " "You must add the operators/machines to be observed, and add the list of activities for each operator/machine. " "Lastly, you must specify the duration of your study."

"\t\tIn creating a project, you are required to choose the z-value of " "the corresponding level of confidence of the study. This z-value will be used in the calculations throughout the study." " Higher confidence level means more accurate results which needs more samples to be recorded. Lower confidence level " "means less accurate results which needs less samples to be recorded."

"\t\tProportion estimates are needed in the calculation of needed samples." "If there are no available data for proportion estimates of the activities, " "it is recommended to conduct preliminary sampling. If you choose to conduct preliminary sampling, you do not have " "to add estimates of proportion for the activity, but you will be required to allot days for preliminary sampling. " "\n\n\t\tIf you choose to input proportion estimates, you will not be conducting preliminary sampling but are required " "to input proportion estimates for each activity of each operator/machine."
"\t\tIn adding an operator or a machine, you must enter the name, " "click on the days of work, specify work hours and break time, and add the list of activities. "

"		In adding an activity, you must enter the name, " "choose the classification of activity, and enter the acceptable error. The acceptable error is the maximum allowable value " "for the error of the activity's proportion, which is also used in the calculation of needed samples. " "

		The input field for proportion estimate " "will be disabled if you have chosen to conduct preliminary sampling, but will be enabled and required if you " "have chosen to input proportion estimates." "

		If you plan on calculating the utilization or allowances for a particular operator/machine, you may click on the switch " "to specify if the activity contributes to the utilization or allowances."

"\t\tThe last part of creating a project is specifying the project duration " "which is divided into two (2) parts: preliminary sampling and actual sampling. If you have chosen to conduct " "preliminary sampling, you will be required to specify the duration for both preliminary and actual sampling. " "You will also be required to generate sampling schedule only for preliminary sampling, since schedule for actual sampling " "will only be generated once preliminary sampling is over." "\n\n\t\tIf you have chosen to input proportion estimates, you will not be asked to input preliminary sampling dates. " "You are only required to specify the duration and generate schedule for actual sampling."
"\t\tOnce a project is successfully created, Sampling Page will be shown. " "There are two (2) tabs in this page: Operators/Machines Tab and Sampling Schedule Tab."

"\t\tIn this tab, the buttons for the operators and machines are shown. " "Clicking on any of the buttons will show the Get Sample Dialog where you may record the sample, or simply view " "partial results for the operator or machine. You may only record samples during the randomized sampling time for " "the operator or machine. You must record the sample in 30 seconds, or you'll miss it." "\n\n\t\tTo record sample, simply click on the button of the activity to be recorded. You may also click on \"Others\" button " "if you want to add a new activity or add remarks."

"\t\tIn this tab, the sampling schedule for the day is shown. " "The buttons show the time for recording a sample, and which operator or machine is to be observed. " "The button turns to green when the sample is recorded, red when missed, and yellow when remarks are added. " "You may click on the buttons to see the details of the sample."

"\t\tIn viewing the results, you may choose the operator or machine from the " "dropdown list, or swipe left/right. You may also click on the buttons of the activities to see the results of each." "\n\n\t\tFor value-adding activities, you may calculate the standard time of producing one unit of output. " "This is done by entering the quantity produced for the activity, the total production hours corresponding to the quantity produced, " "and the performance rating of the operator doing the activity. " "You may also input the allowances to be used, or use the allowances calculated in the study."
